intro: Rosa atroglandulosa, commonly known as the dark glandular rose, is a species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its dark red to purple flowers and hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine conditions. Its foliage is often covered in fine, sticky hairs, which help protect it from harsh weather. Rosa atroglandulosa is a valued ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and hardy nature.
